title: Using the pets package
text: {pets} package designed allow people express feelings pets. present, package rather cat-centric, contains one function: cats().

title: Using the pets package
text: use {pets}, first load package call function cats() logical/boolean argument. example,
code: ## load pets package library(pets)  ## if you love cats cats(TRUE) #> [1] "I love cats!"  ## if you're not a big fan of cats cats(FALSE) #> [1] "I am not a cat person."

title: Authors and Citation
text: Valdivia C (2023). pets: Evaluates Feelings Pets. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pets: Evaluates Your Feelings About Pets},   author = {Celeste Valdivia},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Evaluates Your Feelings About Pets
text: can install development version pets GitHub :

title: Evaluates Your Feelings About Pets
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . also use GitHub Actions re-render README.Rmd every time push. example workflow can found : https://github.com/r-lib/actions/tree/v1/examples. can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(pets) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00
